page.title: 08Leighton Woods. Flowers.
page.content: Over 100, flowers grow in Leighton Woods, but we have seen and collected the following most common ones:- Bracken, ferns, anemone, buttercup, ladysmock, dog violet, dog rose, willowherb, ivy, hogweed, dock, daisy, nettle, cow parsley, primrose, broom, pimpernel, foxglove, birdseye speedwell, bugle, plantain, clover, honeysuckle, coltsfoot, dandelion, bluebell, spotted orchid, red campion, vetch, birdsfoot trefoil, wood sorrel, Herb Robert and wild strawberry. There used to be a small industry called Forest Products selling fencing stakes made of ash, and tent pegs, but it closed in 1984. The forester lives on the slopes of the Mab.
